cyclone.name: FLORENCE
cyclone.current_location: about 785 mi ESE of Cape Fear, North Carolina and 360 mi SSW of Bermuda
cyclone.trajectory: continuing west-northwest then northwest, slowing late Thursday and bending toward the North or South Carolina coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: coast between Cape Fear, NC and South Santee River, SC

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch from Edisto Beach, SC to South Santee River, SC; Tropical-Storm Watch north of NC/VA border to Cape Charles Light, VA and lower Chesapeake Bay.
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane & Storm Surge Warning from South Santee River, SC to Duck, NC including Albemarle and Pamlico Sounds.
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire southeast U.S. coastline from northern Florida through the Carolinas and into the Mid-Atlantic, greatest impacts NC/SC.
weather_observation.storm_surge_above_3_feet: Unlikely (1–2 ft possible south of Edisto Beach)
weather_observation.wind: Low chance (≤20%) of sustained tropical-storm-force winds; occasional gusts 35–45 mph possible this weekend.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor coastal inundation 1–2 ft above ground level mainly at high tide.
weather_observation.rainfall: Outer rain-bands may bring 2–4 in of rainfall Saturday–Monday with localized ponding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents, rough seas affecting vessel approach lanes; potential rail/road disruptions inland if heavy rain spreads over Georgia.
